meanings.definition: Saturated with moisture; wet and limp.
meanings.sent1: The bread became soggy after being left out in the rain.
meanings.sent2: Her shoes were soggy after walking through the puddles.
meanings.sent3: The soggy sandwich felt like a sponge in my hands.
meanings.sent4: The soggy ground squelched under our feet as we walked.
meanings.sent5: The soggy towel hung heavy on the line, dripping water.

meanings.sent1: The cereal turned soggy in the milk.
meanings.sent2: The chips were left out too long and became soggy.
meanings.sent3: The soggy crackers were as soft as pillows.
meanings.sent4: His soggy handshake left my hand feeling damp.
meanings.sent5: The soggy leaves clung to the ground after the storm.
